talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter:
So... your distinction is that "if you publish 3rd party content, you give up your own editorial rights?"  

You sure you want to go down that path?

talk.author: did:plc:bzcqosvjxeavat6x643ugt62
talk.utter:
I'm just not getting this at all.

Social media networks are public spaces, but they're run by third parties and are essentially unaccountable. (Until this law, anyway.)

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter:
That... is not even remotely close to accurate. 

Is your argument that if you open up your property to outsiders, you no longer have the right to remove anyone for breaking your rules? Because... yikes.

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter:

talk.author: did:plc:bzcqosvjxeavat6x643ugt62
talk.utter: Eh, never mind. Let the social media billionaires do anything they want. That seems to be working out GREAT so far.

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: So, to stop people you personally dislike, you think it's cool to strip away their rights based on your feelings. There's a name for people like you.

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: So, to stop people you personally dislike, you think it's cool to strip away their rights based on your feelings. There's a name for people like you.

talk.author: did:plc:yucu4m7ovhqulwtvcjpfil6g
talk.utter: But they're already doing this to us bro, this whole 'oh but they're gonna do it back to you some time down the line" is bullshit! It's already happening!

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: I'm sorry I have principles and don't stoop to the the same justification for my actions as nazis.

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: I'm sorry I have principles and don't stoop to the the same justification for my actions as nazis.

talk.author: did:plc:yucu4m7ovhqulwtvcjpfil6g

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: Lying about my beliefs and my very public stances is... you know... a choice.

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: I'm sorry I have principles and don't stoop to the the same justification for my actions as nazis.

talk.author: did:plc:bzcqosvjxeavat6x643ugt62
talk.utter: Interestingly, free speech absolutism is now a hallmark of the far right.

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: I said nothing about "free speech absolutism." I said it's important to protect rights, not strip them away based on "I don't like these people."

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: So, to stop people you personally dislike, you think it's cool to strip away their rights based on your feelings. There's a name for people like you.

talk.author: did:plc:bzcqosvjxeavat6x643ugt62
talk.utter:
Mike, I can't explain to you that you need to care about people. Empathy is a thing you have to develop for yourself.

Yes, I am willing to take away the rights of, say, white supremacists, and I won't apologize for that. 

Right now, they hold all the power. We either do something or not.

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: I care about people. Which is why I try to teach people like you that justifying taking away people's rights because "they'd do it to us" always leads to the powerful cracking down harder on the powerless and feeling justified. To me, protecting rights is caring about people AND having principals.

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: I care about people. Which is why I try to teach people like you that justifying taking away people's rights because "they'd do it to us" always leads to the powerful cracking down harder on the powerless and feeling justified. To me, protecting rights is caring about people AND having principals.

talk.author: did:plc:bzcqosvjxeavat6x643ugt62
talk.utter:
So far, this approach has been unilaterally unsuccessful at dealing with the rise of fascism. 

It isn't working.

It is _definitely_ getting people killed.

I'm not new to your brand of abrasiveness but this is the first time you ever called me a fascist, so there's that.

Anyway, bye

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter:
I have not called you a fascist. That may be your own guilty conscience speaking.

I will say that adopting their strategies, beliefs, principles, etc. certainly makes you no better than one.

talk.utter: So, to stop people you personally dislike, you think it's cool to strip away their rights based on your feelings. There's a name for people like you.

Mike, I can't explain to you that you need to care about people. Empathy is a thing you have to develop for yourself.

Yes, I am willing to take away the rights of, say, white supremacists, and I won't apologize for that. 

Right now, they hold all the power. We either do something or not.

talk.author: did:plc:bzcqosvjxeavat6x643ugt62
talk.utter: Considering we are barreling right into a second Trump presidency, which means we're looking down the barrel of a national abortion ban, national attacks on LGBTQ, etc, I would hope you'd care about those things.

talk.author: did:plc:cak4klqoj3bqgk5rj6b4f5do
talk.utter: If you think taking away rights will magically stop that, well, I'm sorry... that's just ridiculous
